result.execSummary:
The defendant Johnnie Mertice Wesley was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Felony Murder, an unclassified felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.03.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
CONSEUCTIVE to any other sentence 
Defendant remanded into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

superMiscConds.notes: Pay all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution to be paid through collection by the DPC's from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may not possess any firearms/body armor, and he may not vote until civil rights are restored.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Johnnie Mertice Wesley in court with attorney Debra J Patterson.  Defendant Johnnie Mertice Wesley in custody.  Mark S Williams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Sentencing proceeded.  Presentence Investigation reviewed.  Additions and corrections were made.  Statements by state, defense and defendant.   Additional statements by: Shante A, Sarita F and Eliza S.

The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 27 YEARS consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 144 DAYS time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 20 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 7 YEARS.  The Court finds the defendant is NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program, or the Substance Abuse Program.

The Courts the defendant pay:
Restitution in the amount of $11,048.00 to Sarita F.  All court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may not possess any firearms/body armour, and he may not vote until civil rights are restored.

Court ordered defendant remanded into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

Filed:
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence;
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit;
Restitution Documentation.
Order to Reinstate Mail, Phone Calls, and Visitation at the Milwaukee County Jail, signed and filed.

Defendant Johnnie Mertice Wesley in court with attorney Debra J Patterson.  Defendant Johnnie Mertice Wesley in custody.  Mark S Williams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, and further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. Defendant examined as to plea, and entered a plea of guilty.  Court found defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived all constitutional rights. Plea questionnaire waiver of rights and addendum to plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulated to the criminal complaint as factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered into the record.  Court ordered presentence investigation. Order for presentence investigation filed; copy to Probation Department.  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may not possess any firearms/body armor.  Court advised defendant that he may not vote until civil rights are restored.  Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.  Court ordered case adjourned to Branch 38.
  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 2, 2014 at 08:15 am.
Atty Patterson contacts the court and states that her client wishes to resolve matter with a plea.  Case is set for 5-27-2014 at 8:15am.  ADA Williams is advised of date via email.

Defendant Johnnie Mertice Wesley in court with attorney Debra J Patterson.  Defendant Johnnie Mertice Wesley in custody.  Mark S Williams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
The Court has listened to and reviewed the transcripts and CD's provided by counsel.
Miranda-Goodchild hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State:  Det. Katherine Spano(MPD); Det. Kent Corbett(MPD).  State rests.  Exhibits 1 and 2 received into evidence.
The defense will not be presenting any testimony.  The Court finds the defendant has made a voluntary decision not to testify.
Arguments by counsels.  The Court finds that the defendant was properly mirandized and the statement made was free and voluntary.  The Court denies the motion to suppress.
Defense counsel is requesting that the Court modify its previous order to allow the defendant to RECEIVE mail and phone calls from family.  The State objects to any modification.  The Court will not modify the order at this time.
Case is set for another final pretrial on 6-2-2014.
State's Brief in Opposition to Motion to Suppress Defendant's Statements, received and filed.
to Suppress Defendant's Statements and copies of CD's filed by defense.

Defendant Johnnie Mertice Wesley in court with attorney Debra J. Patterson.  Defendant Johnnie Mertice Wesley in custody.  Mark S. Williams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State motion to restrict defendant's mail, visitation and phone privileges.  Arguments by counsels.
The Court signs order and pursuant to 940.47 the defendant's phone privileges, visitation and mail privileges shall be restricted.  The exception being in-coming and out-going legal correspondence with his counsel, Debra Patterson.
State's Motion to Take Away Defendant's Mail, Telephone and Visitation Privileges at the Milwaukee County Jail, filed by the state.
Subpoena

Certification of transcript of proceedings of  PRELIMINARY HEARING  commencing  FEBRUARY 19, 2014  received and filed. (14 Pages.)
Copy of transcript forwarded to  Debra Patterson - SPD  819 N 6th Street  Milwaukee, WI  53203.
Defense motion to modify bail is argued and DENIED.

Defendant Johnnie Mertice Wesley in court with attorney Debra J Patterson.  Defendant Johnnie Mertice Wesley in custody.  Mark S Williams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.   Case set for final pretrial on 4-28-2014 at 8:15am.  Jury trial set for 6-30-2014 at 8:15am.  All final pretrial documents to be filed by the final pretrial hearing.  All motions to be filed by 3-31-2014.  Miranda-Goodchild hearing to be held on final pretrial date.

Defendant Johnnie Mertice Wesley in court with attorney Steve Sargent for Debra J Patterson.  Defendant Johnnie Mertice Wesley in custody.  Mark S. Williams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Kent Corbett-MPD Detective.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading.  Case is adjourned to Branch 38.  Arraignment scheduled for February 28, 2014 at 08:15 am.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for February 28, 2014 at 08:15 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY  to be monitored by drug testing.   No use or possession of illegal or controlled substances without a valid prescription.
    No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Johnnie Mertice Wesley in court with attorney Debra J Patterson.  Defendant Johnnie Mertice Wesley in custody.  Carole R Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 19, 2014 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Johnnie Mertice Wesley
Current: 2810 W Kilbourn Ave  #10, Milwaukee, WI 53233   (Effective: 02-11-2014)
Prior: 9241 W. Birch Avenue, #4, Milwaukee, WI 53225
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
